intro: Vouapa pittieri, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue petals. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Vouapa pittieri is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
